notes: Surges with a speed of 1250 and disjoints projectiles upon cast

Morphling turns invulnerable, and his hero model cannot be directly selected during Waveform
 However, Morphling can still be selected through the hero icon
 Morphling can turn, attack, cast abilities, and use items during Waveform

With the travel distance and radius, Waveform can hit units up to 900/1000/1100/1200 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 1150/1250/1350/1450) distance away Fully affects invisible enemy units and units in the Fog of War
Does not travel the full distance, when targeting closer than the max distance

TALENT NOTES The Waveform attack targets [picture:talent_tree_symbol] talent causes Morphling to perform instant attacks on every enemy hit by Waveform These instant attacks can proc any attack modifiers and on-hit effects normally They do not have True Strike, but completely ignore disarms Waveform first deals its damage, then applies the instant attacks Does not affect [picture:animal_courier_radiant_minimap] Couriers
abilities.description: Morphling dissolves into liquid and surges forward, damaging enemy units in his path. Morphling is invulnerable during Waveform.
abilities.name: Waveform
abilities.story: A torrential flood takes enemies by force.

notes:
Casting this puts the other Adaptive Strike (Strength) on a fixed 3-second cooldown
 This cooldown can be reset with cooldown resetting abilities, but it is not affected by percentage-based cooldown reductions
The projectile travels at a speed of 1150

The damage multiplier values are not fixed They adapt linearly in smooth intervals depending on the difference between Morphling's [picture:agility_attribute_symbol] agility and [picture:strength_attribute_symbol] strength

The values change with each percent difference between agility and strength, even when it is just a minimal change
 It also checks Morphling's current attributes upon projectile impact
 The multiplier counts both base and bonus attributes
EXPR Damage: 55/65/75/85 + ΣAgi × DamageMultipler Damage Multiplier: 0.5, 1/1.5/2/2.5 when CasterΣAgi × 0.5 > CasterΣStr
abilities.description: Launches a surge of water toward an enemy unit, dealing base damage plus additional damage based on Morphling's agility times a multiplier. If Morphling's agility is 50% higher than strength, the maximum agility multiplier is used. Also puts Adaptive Strike (Strength) on a 3 second cooldown.
abilities.name: Adaptive Strike (Agility)
abilities.story: The Morphling calls upon his elements to crush his opponents with waves.

notes:
Casting this puts the other Adaptive Strike (Agility) on a fixed 3-second cooldown
 This cooldown can be reset with cooldown resetting abilities, but it is not affected by percentage-based cooldown reductions
The projectile travels at a speed of 1150

The knockback and stun values are not fixed They adapt linearly in smooth intervals depending on the difference between Morphling's [picture:agility_attribute_symbol] agility and [picture:strength_attribute_symbol] strength Both values change with each percent difference between agility and strength, even when it is just a minimal change It also checks Morphling's current attributes upon projectile impact The knockback and stun values count both base and bonus attributes

When EXPR CasterΣStr × 0.5 > CasterΣAgi, the knockback and stun duration are at their maximum at 500 and 1.5/2/2.5/3 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 2.5/3/3.5/4) seconds respectively, else the knockback distance and stun duration are at their minimum at 100 and 0.5 ([picture:talent_tree_symbol] 1.5) seconds respectively Knocks the target back at a speed of 1000, resulting in a knockback duration of 0.1 ‒ 0.5 seconds
abilities.description: Launches a surge of water toward an enemy unit, stunning and knocking back the target based on Morphling's strength. If his strength is 50% higher than his agility, the maximum stun/knockback is dealt. Also puts Adaptive Strike (Agility) on a 3 second cooldown.
abilities.name: Adaptive Strike (Strength)
abilities.story: The Morphling calls upon his elements to crush his opponents with waves.

notes: Does not interrupt Morphling's channeling abilities upon toggling

Costs 1/1/1/1 mana per shift interval, resulting in 5/10/15/20 mana per second
 The mana cost per second is fixed and it is not affected by mana loss manipulation

Converts 5/10/15/20 attribute points per second, resulting in the following changes per second: [picture:agility_attribute_symbol]: Gains/loses 0.8/1.7/2.5/3.3 main armor, 5/10/15/20 attack speed, and 5/10/15/20 main attack damage [picture:strength_attribute_symbol]: Gains/loses 100/200/300/400 max health, and 0.5/1/1.5/2 health regeneration The strength bonus/loss counts as setting health, it does not keep the current health percentage but instead adds/removes 20 health per strength to/from the current health pool However, for other amplifications and reductions, only the part that exceeds the current health percentage is affected

Attribute Shift continues to convert attributes even if Morphling is disabled, but cannot be toggled On / Off while disabled SHARD NOTES This restriction is removed upon acquring [picture:aghanim's_shard] Aghanim's Shard, allowing Morphling to toggle Attribute Shift even while disabled However, Morphling is now unable to ⇧ Shift-queue this ability It can be toggled while stunned, cycloned, slept, taunted, hidden, or during forced movement, but not while silenced, hexed or prevented from acting

Toggling one Attribute Shift ability On automatically toggles the other Off
 If Attribute Shift cannot convert anymore due to a lack of attribute points or mana, the toggle status remains the same, but the process is paused until it can continue

Can only convert Morphling's base agility and strength Bonus attributes are not converted The agility bonus is granted as bonus attributes, and it effectively grants 0.5/0.83/1.17/1.5 ([picture:aghanim's_shard_symbol] 1.5/1.83/2.17/2.5) main armor, and 3/5/7/9 ([picture:aghanim's_shard_symbol] 9/11/13/15) attack speed and main attack damage bonus
Shifted attributes are permanent and not reverted on death
abilities.description: Morphling shifts its form, pulling points from Strength and pouring them into Agility. The process is reversible. Additional points in Attribute Shift increase the rate of stat change. Passively grants bonus Agility.
abilities.name: Attribute Shift (Agility Gain)
abilities.story: Shifting water makes it difficult to discern the nature of Morphling.

notes: Same notes as for [picture:attribute_shift_%28agility_gain%29] Attribute Shift (Agility Gain) apply
Does not interrupt Morphling's channeling abilities upon toggling

The strength bonus is granted as bonus attributes, and it effectively grants 60/100/140/180 ([picture:aghanim's_shard_symbol] 180/220/260/300) health and 0.3/0.5/0.7/0.9 ([picture:aghanim's_shard_symbol] 0.9/1.1/1.3/1.5) health regeneration bonus
Shifted attributes are permanent and not reverted on death
abilities.description: Morphling shifts its form, pulling points from Agility and pouring them into Strength. The process is reversible. Additional points in Attribute Shift increase the rate of stat change. Passively grants bonus Strength.
abilities.name: Attribute Shift (Strength Gain)
abilities.story: Shifting water makes it difficult to discern the nature of Morphling.

notes: Does not replace Morphling with a clone of the target Morph only copies the target's model, hitbox, including equipped cosmetic items This means he is still registered as Morphling, therefore it neither acquires innate abilities nor other innate ability traits (e.g being able to attack [picture:nightmare] Nightmared units) This also means that Morphling can still be killed normally in the Morphed form since it is still him and not a separate clone or illusion Morphling is visually distinguishable from the original hero while Morphed Neither dispels buff and debuffs upon morphing and unmorphing Most channeling abilities are interrupted upon unmorphing, except for [picture:phase_shift] Phase Shift, [picture:upheaval] Upheaval, and casting item abilities

Morphling keeps his current health and mana percentages upon morphing
 Does not copy the target's current health or mana

Also copies the target's attribute values, primary attribute, movement speed, attack range, and range type This means when targeting a melee strength hero, Morphling becomes a [picture:melee] melee [picture:strength_attribute_symbol] strength hero for the duration This causes items that use different values for melee and ranged heroes (e.g [picture:manta_style] Manta Style) to now adapt to Morphling accordingly Attack range bonuses are not overridden and still work normally Only copies the target's base attributes Bonus attributes from abilities and items are not copied All other base stats (e.g attack values, armor, magic resistance, etc.) are not copied either Does not copy the target's transformed state as well (e.g [picture:elder_dragon_form] Elder Dragon Form)
Morphling keeps his own items during Morph, he does not copy the target's items

Can only be cast on enemy heroes, including illusions and clones Cannot be cast on creep-heroes When cast on illusions, it copies the hero who owns the illusion and not the hero the illusion is based on Therefore, casting ability on an illusion based on a dead hero does nothing For example, when targeting [picture:disruption] Disruption illusions, Morphling turns into [picture:shadow_demon_minimap] Shadow Demon, and not the hero Disruption was cast on However, it cannot target Morphling itself or illusions under Morphling's control An [picture:enchant] Enchanted Morphling illusion is still treated as its own illusion and can still not be targeted

SCEPTER NOTES Morph now places a buff on Morphling and a debuff on the target, based on the target's primary attribute Targeted [picture:strength_attribute_symbol] strength heroes lose 40% status resistance while Morphling gains it Stacks multiplicatively with other sources of status resistance Targeted [picture:agility_attribute_symbol] agility heroes lose 70 attack speed while Morphling gains it Targeted [picture:intelligence_attribute_symbol] intelligence heroes lose 25% spell damage amplification while Morphling gains it Applies generic outgoing damage manipulation Stacks additively with other sources of generic outgoing damage manipulation The manipulation affects only spell damage the target deals that is not flagged as HP removal All targets lose 20% of all their attributes, while Morphling gains based on how much the target lost The attributes are removed and granted as bonus attributes Does not change base attributes All values are set upon cast and do not adapt to any changes They persist even when losing [picture:aghanim's_scepter] Aghanim's Scepter The modifiers are independent from each other, when one loses its modifier, the other still keeps it SPELL STEAL This ability is not acquirable SOULBIND Morph only affects the primary target
abilities.description: Morphling changes his form to match the targeted enemy, gaining their basic abilities. Can be toggled for the duration of the ability.
abilities.name: Morph
abilities.story: Staring into Morphling produces a reflection that mimics the beholder.

notes: Morph Replicate replaces [picture:morph] Morph until it expires The Legacy Keys for Morph Replicate is the same as the target's ultimate ability's Legacy Keys
Interrupts Morphling's channeling abilities upon cast

Casting this does not end Morph
 Instead, it shifts Morphling back to his original form
 When used again, it shifts Morphling back into the target
 Goes on cooldown whenever forms get shifted

Upon each [picture:morph] Morph and [picture:morph_replicate] Morph Replicate cast, it checks for Morphling and the affected target's basic abilities, then it removes Morphling's abilities and replaces them with the affected target's basic abilities, including their passive abilities and sub-abilities Therefore, Morphling has to cast Morph Replicate twice to update all copied abilities and their values This affects the following things: [picture:invoke] Invoked abilities New basic abilities acquired via [picture:spell_steal] Spell Steal upon morphing into them New [picture:devour] Devoured and [picture:talent_tree_symbol] [picture:death_pact] Death Pact abilities Non-ultimate abilities granted by [picture:aghanim's_scepter] Aghanim's Scepter and [picture:aghanim's_shard] Aghanim's Shard are only copied if both Morphling and the affected target have the respective item as well Does not copy [picture:talent_tree_symbol] talent upgrades at all
abilities.description: Toggles Morphling's form between his own and the replicated enemy.
abilities.name: Morph Replicate

description: Rides the waves to flank enemies. After eons of travel in the darkness of space, the icy comet plunged to earth, and from there rose an elemental being of sentient liquid. Unbound by any permanent shape, the Morphling Alters Attributes to match his needs and Morphs into a replication of his foes, mimicking their capabilities, making them fight against a copy of themselves. Shifting between potent attacker, and resilient survivor, Morphling can be as elusive as he is deadly. Assuming the form of a Wave to flank an enemy, he surges forward before performing Adaptive Strikes of water that either sting or bludgeon the victims depending on his composition.  Carry Escape Durable Nuker Disabler ★★★
trivia: In DotA, Morphling was the only hero without a hero name, being named "Morphling the Morphling".
The attack response Link▶️ "Wave of mutilation!" is a direct reference to a Pixies song of the same name.
history: For dark eons the comet circled. Held in thrall to a distant sun, bound by gravity’s inexorable pull, the massive ball of ice careened through the blackness between worlds, made strange by its dark journey. On the eve of the ancient war of the Vloy, it punched down through the sky and lit a glowing trail across the night, a sign both armies took for an omen. The frozen ball melted in a flash of boiling heat, as below two forces enjoined in battle across the border of a narrow river. Thus freed from its icy stasis, the Morphling was born into conflict, an elemental power at one with the tides of the ocean, capricious and unconstrained. He entered the fight, instinctively taking the form of the first general who dared set foot across the water, and then struck him dead. As the motley warriors clashed, he shifted from form to form throughout the battle, instantly absorbing the ways of these strange creatures--now a footsoldier, now an archer, now the cavalryman--until, by the time the last soldier fell, Morphling had played every part. The battle's end was his beginning.

notes: The magic resistance talent stacks multiplicatively with other sources of magic resistance. Increases Morphling's magic resistance to 36.25%.
Increases Morphling's magic resistance to 36.25%.
The agility talent effectively grants Morphling 2.5 main armor, 15 attack speed, and 15 main attack damage bonus.
The strength talent effectively grants Morphling 700 health and 3.5 health regeneration bonus.
